to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite

sentences.english: The third part is the experimental analysis of Pakistani students' double words tone.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，巴基斯坦留学生双字调的实验分析。

sentences.english: Therefore, we can say the tones of Chinese characters do not obviously affect intonation.
sentences.chinese: 因此，可以说字调对语调的影响并不明显。

sentences.english: The intonation anomalous form's basic situation divides into the double word well distributed three tones.
sentences.chinese: 以及声调变体的基本情况，分为双字调和三字调。

definition: entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
oblique tone/nonlevel tone/uneven tone (the third tone of Classical Chinese)
to notate music/to write a score
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
